item.title: Report X-2024081406
item.description:
Report X-2024081406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: READING
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell contacted safety to report that trailer 572156 caught on fire while on the 241/RDG yard. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell stated that after ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck arrived at 241/RDG the lead trailer 572156 started smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry S chreck advised that after he arrived at 241/RDG he was about to unhook his set when he noticed the lead trailer 572156 was smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that he then proceeded to disconnect rear trailer 500713 and converter gear 71708 from the lead trailer. ABF Road Driver Terry Sch reck advised that he then proceeded to move trailer 572156 to the middle of the yard before he disconnected the trailer from tractor 13383. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that after he disconnected trailer 572156 from the tractor the Reading Fire Department arrived on scene. Deputy Chief Glor e of the Reading Fire Department advised that he believes a pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries shifted during transit. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the battery post may have contacted metal causing them to arc igniting a pallet of writing pens that were incased in carboard that was loaded underneath the pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the Reading Fire Department was able to put the fire out and made sure no drains or waterways were impacted. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell advised he will send photos of the damage to safety. Safety contacted CURA and sp oke with Cameron Kerr to conduct cleanup procedures.

item.title: Report X-2024081400
item.description:
Report X-2024081400

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 4.5 KGS OF DRY ICE COOLING A BIRTHDAY CAKE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 853E2X, CHOANIES BAKERY, 605 HAZEL ST, LEBANON PA 17042-6034.

item.title: Report X-2024081342
item.description:
Report X-2024081342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-10
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024081342 RESPONDER REPORTED TO IRREG 6. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE BELT BOX HAD A WET SPOT ON SIDE OF BOX. NO LIQUID ON BELT. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. 2. X-2024081343 RESPONDER REPORTED TO IRREG 6. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECITION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE BELT. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER. NO LIQUID ON THE BELT NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024080489
item.description:
Report E-2024080489

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 5, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of paint to the trailer interior, surrounding freight, and pavement below the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel containerized the damaged pail and impacted pallet in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all paint impacted material in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum for waste.

item.title: Report X-2024081206
item.description:
Report X-2024081206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER CLEANED UP PACKAGE AT BOTTOM OF SLIDE AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP CAGE. RESPONDER, WEARING FULL PPE, READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 PACKAGE. NO FREE LIQUID WAS IN DAMAGE, SO NO PH TAPE NEEDED. CONTAINED ALL OF THE DAMAGE AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. REFERRED TO WASTE DISPOSAL CHART FOR DISPOSITION AND DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST.

item.title: Report E-2024080462
item.description:
Report E-2024080462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1789 Transchem Muriatic Acid from several boxes of (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the pallet/packaging only located on the dock. The bottles appeared to be leaking from the caps as a result of expansion caused by heat. The leaking jugs were collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All impacted cardboard was neutralized and containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024070092
item.description:
Report I-2024070092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: LAKE ARIEL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 132700
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver made reversed hose connections to tractor mounted product pump. This caused the pump to draft from the receiving AST and into the transport trailer, ultimately overfilling the compartment, filling the vapor system, and releasing to the ground. The compartment dome lid was forced up due to pressure releasing larger amount until pump could be stopped. Product flowed by natura gravity to a retention pond adjacent to the AST delivery area. Lewis Environmental responded for remediation of ground and affected water retention pond.

item.title: Report I-2024070091
item.description:
Report I-2024070091

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: EPHRATA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11525
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Delivery driver failed to make proper hose connection to drop fitting. Driver opened delivery valve releasing approximately 10 gallons to concrete lot. Rainwater carried product into storm sewer. Product traveled through storm sewer to Cocalico Creek (1/4 mile away). Lewis Environmental reacted with containment booms in creek to contain. Booms remained in place to absorb any residual until no further evidence of product remained.

item.title: Report X-2024080973
item.description:
Report X-2024080973

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: PITTSBURGH
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the PITR location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans separated by fiberboard dividers three of the cans had positive closure rings. One can did not have a closure ring and lid came off spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
